p: Based on the broth microdilution assays, the Gram-positive bacterium (i.e., S. aureus) was the most susceptible microorganism, with a minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) of 128 μg/mL against the aqueous methanol extract of the aerial parts of Z. spinosa. The Ap-AME extract also showed appreciable activity with MICs of 512 and 1024 μg/mL against the growth of P. mirabilis and K. pneumoniae, respectively.
